intro: Zephyranthes cuyana, commonly known as the Cuyana rain lily, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Argentina and Chile. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Its bulbs are adapted for storing water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. Zephyranthes cuyana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
